page.title: 19A TYPICAL HOLIDAY ACCOUNT
page.content: My wife and I, our daughter-in-law, son and their two daughters aged 11 and 5, travelled to Mullion from Suffolk in two cars. We chose Mullion for our 14-day holiday as it is different scenically from East Anglia. We stayed at Trenance Farm. The outbuildings had been converted to living accommodation and additional new chalets had been built. Each had 3 bedrooms,bathroom, a kitchen and a lounge/diner.They were all designed for self-catering.Laundry facilities were available in the main building. Food could be bought in the local shops.Most days were spent in nearby Polurrian Cove with safe bathing. We walked along stretches of the coastal path. Most days we had picnic lunches but occasionally ate meals in a local pub.Occasional visits were made to Cadgwith, the Lizard and Kynance Cove.
